marketNews.title: Trump Says Trade with China Will Be Fine After Threatening Additional Tariffs
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Sunday (10/13) said that US trade relations with China "will be fine." This statement was a change from his statement on Friday (10/11), where he threatened to impose an additional tariff of 100 percentage point on goods originating from China, as well as control all exports of crucial US-made software to China starting November 1, 2025. Trump explained that the threat was based on China's decision to tighten restrictions on the export of rare earth minerals starting December 1, 2025, which also includes equipment used to mine and refine these commodities. China itself produces 90% of the world's processed rare earths and rare earth magnets, which are used in applications ranging from electric vehicles to military radar. Reuters reported that the export restrictions on rare earth minerals that China will implement include the obligation for exporters to obtain a license before exporting products containing more than 0.1% of China-origin rare earth or those produced using Chinese technology. Licenses will be granted to eligible parties, although the specific terms have not yet been announced. China will also reject export applications for rare earth minerals related to the defense sector, and will strictly examine applications related to advanced semiconductors and certain types of artificial intelligence. Responding to Trump's threat, the Chinese government urged both countries to immediately return to negotiations, although it stated it was ready to take retaliatory measures if the US does not revoke its policy. For context, US import tariffs for products originating from China currently stand at 30%, while China's import tariffs for US goods are 10%. Responding to developments on Friday (10/11), US stock markets corrected significantly, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq falling by -2.7% and -3.6% respectively. However, S&P 500 and Nasdaq stock futures strengthened by ~1% in Monday (10/13) afternoon trading, following Trump's softened comments over the weekend. Key Takeaway Reflecting on previous tariff escalations, there is a potential that the threat of tariff increases announced by Trump is an attempt by the US to negotiate with China, considering the temporary tariff postponement deadline will expire in mid-November 2025. Trump and Chinese President, Xi Jinping, are scheduled to meet at the APEC Summit 2025 in South Korea on October 31-November 1, 2025. Although Trump on Friday (10/11) mentioned that he did not see the need to meet Xi, Trump clarified that his side had not canceled the meeting schedule.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Indonesian government plans to establish a financial hub in Bali to attract international banks, investment managers, and private equity firms. The government plans to model the area similarly to Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT City) in India and the Dubai International Financial Center (DIFC) in the United Arab Emirates. This zone will offer tax incentives, regulatory leniency, and bureaucratic simplification. Bloomberg also mentioned that this zone will have a different legal framework, with the government reportedly considering Singapore's legal system as a reference. The policy draft is currently being compiled by the Ministry of Finance and the National Economic Council, with a target discussion date at the DPR by the end of 2025. National Economic Council Spokesperson, Jodi Mahardi, has confirmed this issue to Kontan. Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor, Juda Agung, told Kontan on Friday (10/11) that his side is optimistic that banking credit growth can meet the target range of +8-11% YoY (vs. 8M25: +7.56% YoY) because banks usually boost performance in the fourth quarter. Previously, the Ministry of Finance was also optimistic that credit growth could accelerate to +10% YoY, supported by the realization of credit disbursement from liquidity injections to State-Owned Banks (Himbara). Reuters reported that the recess allowance for each DPR member increased from 400 million rupiah to 702 million rupiah per recess period. Reuters mentioned that DPR members generally take recess about 5 times per year. DPR Deputy Chairman, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, stated that this allowance increase takes effect from October 3, 2025, and was approved by the Ministry of Finance in May 2025. Previously, the government had revoked several facilities for DPR members to quell national demonstrations at the end of August 2025.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Targets Gold and Tungsten Production Starting June 2026
tickerNews.content: BUMI: Bumi Resources Advisor, Christopher Fong, said that Wolfram Limited will commence gold production in June 2026, with a target to produce around 75,000-100,000 troy ounces of gold per year within 12 months after production starts. In a separate information disclosure, Chengdong Investment Corporation sold ~3.7 billion BUMI shares at an average price of ~124 rupiah per share, totaling ~459 billion rupiah, during the June-October 2025 period. Following this transaction, Chengdong Investment Corporation's ownership in BUMI decreased from 9.99% to 8.99%.

tickerNews.title: Investcorp Cancels Valuation Differences Cited as Reason for Halting Acquisition of CAMP Majority Stake
tickerNews.content: CAMP: DealStreetAsia reported that Bahrain-based investment manager, Investcorp, has canceled the acquisition of Campina Ice Cream Industry, with several DealStreetAsia sources citing valuation mismatch as the cause. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported in June 2024 that Investcorp planned to buy a majority stake in CAMP from its controller, Sabana Prawirawidjaja, who currently owns 83.94% of CAMP shares. After discussions with Investcorp were canceled, DealStreetAsia mentioned that CAMP shareholders have been in talks with other potential buyers. DealStreetAsia sources mentioned that Sriwijaya Capital - backed by the Barito, Indika, and Sinar Mas groups - is among the interested parties, though no binding agreement has been reached. CAMP and Investcorp declined to comment on this news, while Sriwijaya Capital has not yet provided comments to DealStreetAsia.

tickerNews.title: CUAN's Subsidiary Signs Agreement to Acquire 90% Stake in PT Guna Darma Integra for 680 MW Power Plant Project
tickerNews.content: CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi, through its subsidiary, PT Volta Daya Energi Indonesia, announced that it has signed an agreement to acquire a 90% stake in PT Guna Darma Integra (GDI). GDI will develop a power plant project with a capacity of 680 MW in the Feni Haltim Integrated Industrial Park, North Maluku. The project value is estimated to reach 600 million US dollars or ~10 trillion rupiah, with project construction targeted over 24 months.

tickerNews.title: SOSS Announces Merger with Controller AB, Expected to Increase Net Revenue by +14% Post-Merger
tickerNews.content: SOSS: Shield On Service announced plans to merge with its current controller, PT Alsok Bass Indonesia Security Services (AB), with SOSS as the surviving entity. This merger aims to increase efficiency and reduce costs by combining similar operations and resources. The agreed merger exchange ratio is 1 AB share for 1.979 combined company shares (SOSS). Referring to the proforma merger table attached by the company, SOSS's net revenue post-merger will increase by +14% to 1.1 trillion rupiah, while net profit will decrease from 504 million rupiah to a loss of 17 billion rupiah. This plan will be discussed in an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on December 17, 2025, while the merger is targeted to be complete on April 1, 2026.

tickerNews.title: PANI Denies Tropical Coastland Project is Part of its Area Following Removal from National Strategic Projects List
tickerNews.content: PANI: Bisnis reported that the Tropical Coastland project has been officially removed from the list of national strategic projects (PSN), based on Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Regulation Number 16 of 2025. Previously, this project was included in the tourism sector PSN list under Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Regulation Number 12 of 2024. Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Corporate Secretary, Christy Grassela, told Kontan that the Tropical Coastland project is not part of PANI's scope of work. Christy also explained to Bisnis that the Tropical Coastland project is entirely located in protected forest areas under the authority of the Ministry of Forestry and the Ministry of Environment and Forestry, supervised by Perhutani. According to Christy, the removal of Tropical Coastland from the PSN list is the government's prerogative.

tickerNews.title: SMKM Controller Sells Up to 35.91% Stake to Lim Shrimp Org Pte. Ltd., Making it the New Controller
tickerNews.content: SMKM: Sumber Mas Konstruksi announced that the company's controller, PT Vina Nauli Jordania, has signed an agreement to sell up to 35.91% of SMKM shares to Lim Shrimp Org Pte. Ltd., which is lower than the previous announcement of up to 44.98%. The transaction value has not been announced. After this transaction is completed, Lim Shrimp Org Pte. Ltd. will become the new controller of the company and execute a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: PIPA Completes Acquisition of 43.78% Shares by PT Morris Capital Indonesia
tickerNews.content: PIPA: Multi Makmur Lemindo announced that PT Morris Capital Indonesia on Friday (10/11) completed the acquisition of 43.78% of PIPA shares at an average price of 10.6 rupiah per share, totaling approximately 15.9 billion rupiah. For context, PIPA previously announced that PT Morris Capital Indonesia would acquire 57.37% of PIPA shares.
